name: gulch
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a deep narrow valley with steep sides, especially one formed by fast-flowing water : At the head of the trail, he stopped to peer down into the gulch. The storm carved out a gulch where the creek now flows. Synonym
ravineCompare
gully
Scott Hardesty/Cavan/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThey planned to lay wooden beams over the gulch and drive across.He lay bleeding and unable to walk at the bottom of a gulch.He knows every peak, island, gulch, lake, and river of this region.Several springs and gulches provide water for the mining operation.
